[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Trait: Logger] [Trait Object Safety] The Logger trait is used as dyn Logger trait object - are there any methods that should be excluded but aren't, causing runtime errors or panics when called through the trait object? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Global State: LOGGER] [Type Confusion] Can an attacker somehow swap out the Logger implementation at runtime (beyond the OnceCell protection) to inject a malicious logger that drops security events or exfiltrates sensitive data? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Conditional Compilation] [Feature Detection] The #[cfg(feature = 'tokio-console')] block is only compiled when the feature is enabled - can this create binary compatibility issues where validators compiled with different features behave differently, breaking consensus? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Function: set_global_logger()] [Feature Mismatch] If tokio_console_port is Some but the binary wasn't compiled with tokio-console feature, only an error is logged - can this silent degradation lead operators to believe they have console monitoring when they don't, missing performance attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Global State: LOGGER] [Init Order] If LOGGER is accessed during static initialization of other global variables, can this cause initialization order issues where the logger is used before it's properly set up, leading to crashes or undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Function: set_global_logger()] [Async Context] Can set_global_logger() be safely called from an async context or must it be called from a synchronous initialization path - if called during async init, can this cause deadlocks or race conditions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Function: dispatch()] [Panic Propagation] If logger.record() panics, does the panic propagate up the call stack potentially aborting critical validator operations, or is there panic catching that could hide the panic and continue with inconsistent state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Function: set_global_logger()] [Init Panic] If ConsoleLayer::builder().spawn() panics, does this abort validator initialization or is the panic caught somewhere, leaving the node in a half-initialized state that could lead to consensus failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Function: set_global_logger()] [Multiple Calls] In test environments where tests run in parallel, can multiple tests try to call set_global_logger() concurrently, causing race conditions or test failures that mask real security bugs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Global State: LOGGER] [Process Lifecycle] OnceCell persists for the entire process lifetime - if the validator needs to reinitialize logging (e.g., during configuration reload), can the inability to reset LOGGER cause the validator to operate with stale or incorrect logging configuration? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Function: dispatch()] [Format String] Event contains fmt::Arguments for the message - can an attacker control the format string to trigger format string vulnerabilities in the logger implementation, potentially leading to information disclosure or code execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Import: Event] [Key-Value Injection] Event's keys_and_values field contains &[&dyn Schema] - can an attacker inject malicious Schema implementations that execute arbitrary code when visited by the logger, compromising validator integrity? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Function: dispatch()] [Non-Repudiation] Can an attacker prevent specific security events from being logged by manipulating the enabled() check or causing record() to fail, thereby erasing evidence of their attack from the audit trail? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Function: flush()] [Log Integrity] Does flush() guarantee that all events are durably persisted before returning - if not, can a sudden validator crash or power loss after flush() returns cause buffered security events to be lost? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Trait: Logger::record()] [Timestamp Manipulation] Does record() add timestamps, and if so, can an attacker manipulate system time to forge log timestamps, making it appear that attacks happened at different times and evading forensic analysis? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Import: once_cell] [OnceCell Bugs] Are there known vulnerabilities in the once_cell crate's OnceCell implementation that could allow double initialization or race conditions when setting LOGGER under high concurrency? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Import: tracing_subscriber] [Tracing Bugs] Can vulnerabilities in tracing_subscriber's Registry or layer composition be exploited to bypass logging, cause panics, or leak memory during high-volume logging scenarios? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-logger/src/logger.rs] [Import: console_subscriber] [Console Vulnerabilities] Does console_subscriber have any known RCE or authentication bypass vulnerabilities that would allow remote attackers to compromise validators with tokio-console enabled? (High)
